ARABIC: قَالَ ٱجْعَلْنِى عَلَىٰ خَزَآئِنِ ٱلْأَرْضِ إِنِّى حَفِيظٌ عَلِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Entrust the country's stores to me. In truth I am a knowing guardian.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Appoint me over the granaries of the land," (he said); "I shall be a knowledgeable keeper."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Joseph said: "Place me in charge of the treasures of the land. I am a good keeper and know my task well."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Joseph said, "Put me in charge of the treasuries of the land. I know how to manage them."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Yusuf, “Appoint me over the treasures of the earth; indeed I am a protector, knowledgeable.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: [Yusuf] said: "Set me over the storehouses of the land; I will indeed guard them with full knowledge."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Place me (in authority) over the treasures of the land, surely I am a good keeper, knowing well.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'Set me over the land's storehouses; I am a knowing guardian.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land. Lo! I am a skilled custodian.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Joseph said, "Place in my charge the storehouses of the land; for I am a good and knowledgeable custodian."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: set me over the store houses of the land; verily I shall be a keeper knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘Put me in charge of the country’s granaries. I am indeed fastidious [and]well-informed.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Joseph) said: "Set me over the store-houses of the land: I will indeed guard them, as one that knows (their importance)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Yusuf (Joseph)] said: "Set me over the storehouses of the land; I will indeed guard them with full knowledge" (as a minister of finance in Egypt, in place of Al-'Aziz who was dead at that time).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He (Joseph) said: 'Give me charge of the storehouses of the land, I am a knowledgeable guardian'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “Put me in charge of the storehouses of the land; I am honest and knowledgeable.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Joseph] said, "Appoint me over the storehouses of the land. Indeed, I will be a knowing guardian."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:55] He, Joseph, said, ‘Place me in charge of the storehouses of the land, the land of Egypt. I am indeed a skilled custodian’, one worthy of custodianship thereof, and knowledgeable in such affairs — it is also said [that he meant]: [I am indeed] a [competent] scribe and accountant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 249 (He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land) appoint me in charge of the treasury of Egypt (I am a skilled custodian) I am skilled in its estimation and know the time when people go hungry; it is also said that this means: I am trustworthy regarding that with which you have entrusted me, and also know the languages of the strangers who come to you.
